Hi
   
          Regarding the drawing, good job! It captures PMK Saitou's 'essence'. Ha! The sleepy eyes of death. 
   
          Regarding Saitou's childhood, well there is a minute part in book 5 of PMK Kurogane. The first page, I think... Saitou seeing himself when he was a child in his blade. But it was only the back view. 
   
         Truth is, Saitou is pretty much neglected in PMK. Not much character development there. Even Kaze no Hikaru does better there. Though I personally like the protrayal of Saitou there least.
   
  Divertimento

secretary <secretarytocapt3@...> wrote:
  I've seen fanart of the PMK cast as kids e.g. OKita/Hijikata

poor Saitou has been neglected

PMK SAitou is WAAAAAY easier to drawn than RK Saitou (one line wrong
and his face/body is totally -not- right, that is part of the finesse
of Watsuki's bold style)

http://1happyturtle.com/makoto/PMKSHteenager.jpg

I call it "the Sleepy Eyes of Death" (yes from the samurai film)
it fits PMK Saitou's personality

the thing to the left is a dragon---the circles are his prayer beads
